Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • Course

  • public class Course
extends java.lang.Object
    Felicia Ho, Christine Shao, Andrew Lee Course Program class that has "has a" relationship with Student class.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Course()
      Default constructor Default constructors do not need any parameters.
      Course(java.util.ArrayList<Student> students, int classNum, java.lang.String className)
      Overloaded constructor When this is called from the client/runner, the class fields will get the value from its corresponding formal parameter passed in from a call to construct the object Also incrementing the total Courses because creating another course object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToClassList(Student s)
      Allows client to modify studList by adding a student to the class list (studList) Student object itself includes subjects, numID and name If the class already has that student, the same student will not be added (no repetition)
      static Course compareClassSize(Course a, Course b)
      static Compares the size of two courses (ArrayList) Returns the course that has the most students However, if both courses have the same number of students, method returns null
      java.lang.String getCourseName()
      Allows client to access the class field courseName but client cannot modify it without using the modifier method (corr.) Returns the course name
      int getCourseNum()
      Allows client to access the class field courseNum But client cannot modify it without using the modifier method (corr.) Returns the course's number
      java.util.ArrayList<Student> getStudList()
      Allows client to access the class field studlist but client cannot modify it without using the modifier method (corr.) Returns the array list of students in a certain class
      static int getTotalCourses()
      Allows client to access the class field totalCourses but client cannot modify it without using the modifier method (corr.) Returns the totalCourses (all courses made) static fields must be referenced from a static method
      void removeFromClassList(Student s)
      Allows client to modify studlist by removing a specified student from the class list of students
      java.lang.String toString()
      String representation of the object that is calling toString() Will print out: the studlist = courseName (courseNum) calls the printArray helper function to print the studList array list

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Course

        public Course()
        Default constructor Default constructors do not need any parameters. When this is called from the client/runner, will set class fields to its respective values Set the list of students to null, courseNum to 0, courseName to empty string, increment the totalCourses number

      • Course

        public Course(java.util.ArrayList<Student> students,
              int classNum,
              java.lang.String className)
        Overloaded constructor When this is called from the client/runner, the class fields will get the value from its corresponding formal parameter passed in from a call to construct the object Also incrementing the total Courses because creating another course object
        Parameters:
        students - the list of students for that class
        classNum - the course number
        className - the course name

      • getTotalCourses

        Allows client to access the class field totalCourses but client cannot modify it without using the modifier method (corr.) Returns the totalCourses (all courses made) static fields must be referenced from a static method
        Returns:
        totalCourses

      • addToClassList

        public void addToClassList(Student s)
        Allows client to modify studList by adding a student to the class list (studList) Student object itself includes subjects, numID and name If the class already has that student, the same student will not be added (no repetition)
        Parameters:
        s - the student to be added to the studList

      • removeFromClassList

        public void removeFromClassList(Student s)
        Allows client to modify studlist by removing a specified student from the class list of students
        Parameters:
        s - the removal of the student after searching through the class list

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        String representation of the object that is calling toString() Will print out: the studlist = courseName (courseNum) calls the printArray helper function to print the studList array list
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String to print out onto the screen

      • compareClassSize

        public static Course compareClassSize(Course a,
                                      Course b)
        static Compares the size of two courses (ArrayList) Returns the course that has the most students However, if both courses have the same number of students, method returns null
        Parameters:
        a - one course
        b - another course
        Returns:
        the course with biggest class size (a) - if a's size is greater than b's size
